stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Phishing Emails Delivers Gh0st RAT
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
On 14 May 2014 a phishing email was sent from bstears@att.net with the subject "That's so exciting!" to multiple users at educational institutions, U.S. Government Agencies, private sector organizations, and individual webmail addresses. The email included the malicious attachment surprize.zip, which contained the Gh0st remote administration tool (RAT). The Gh0st RAT communicates with the domain mtjyzx.com.
The reporting source tracks this activity under the name "Lonely Warrior".

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
---- BEGIN EMAIL HEADER ---- Content-Type : multipart/mixed; boundary="-2076221306-984708307-1400075277=:63027" DKIM-Signature : v=1; a=rsa-sha256; c=relaxed/relaxed; d=att.net; s=s1024; t=1400075278; bh=6fQhTm2ZPTG52qV1Bz7KQWX3v8/b1u1dg5mPVOlGnnw=; h=Message-ID:Date:From:Reply-To:Subject:To:MIME-Version:Content-Type; b=Nbwi5UEOcs/icGBHAmo3onDLwV/SwqHmuEU1GhPNRJSCg+m8aA/LZ1CgbiGaJhbIE4YELkPqrjl/3cZx+XkF8wJ+izbm7McK03Mff4st0kYYJs6VTBPucPHHRQZpOw5MIsR2mgv9RM0ukpKrLMUItXfFR2vp3IrxzFC41//16Ow= Date : Wed, 14 May 2014 06:47:57 -0700 (PDT) From : [REDACTED] MIME-Version : 1.0 Message-ID : <1400075277.63027.YahooMailNeo@web181504.mail.ne1.yahoo.com> Received : from [1.86.183.63] by web181504.mail.ne1.yahoo.com via HTTP; Wed, 14 May 2014 06:47:57 PDT Reply-To : [REDACTED] Return-Path : Subject : That's so exciting! To : [REDACTED] X-Mailer : YahooMailWebService/0.8.188.663 X-Rocket-MIMEInfo : 002.001,CgEwAQEBAQ-- X-SENDER-IP : 98.138.120.54 X-SENDER-REPUTATION : 5.5 X-YMail-OSG : I8HlH2gVM1nubDRDV7oz9uUvIsIV4qNCQDmbcM6wpxZcB_S Sf.Cu11hHsosz_PcXiJkz1DSPhCRKW4A0ZSr1tCOSK9s1yn4V1SGQB3a.iY0 lTkS9nY6lhr0eqMxTp5spIaA62HKZ5pLOFg1YhD.4S_X2HdJDJ28XOnS9M7F fPiqfP.Ms0NFLTwrf9Jshr4S3hK4qUmOUo6I0DFYSuc5On7frihKSdwSDC5h NLUipvREbh1uYKsCAJDMZHYKQdrZRGgIIVs3AyFOpIIclO9olXR2ZOCsUhen _rM0GgLa6FUbg6u16hu.kwPfKilht6UXYtkZsBAppR4jMeI7oqfOeHSMyJnZ WOPOfId87bXB7opTyTksQXV7eO.kb2.sp1HXLkiiXehGEgs7VyqQ9DmaeVmT X7ZiaEGGuNRLDaWBRoHo_HQ0WyE4JYALR134KYVjTguvdkZo0Rpsv0WtFFCN EhI4Lt7RC5TGCwHZzZHhBxabGOMqGrmFCWVHHhCKeEvLRvk53CkhZyOMpoov 6EId06GSbBryxsCUXXkGWTt1ol7n.Dwi7 X-Yahoo-Newman-Id : 83579.24822.bm@omp1026.access.mail.bf1.yahoo.com X-Yahoo-Newman-Property : ymail-4 ---- END EMAIL HEADER ---- ---- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ----
---- END EMAIL BODY ---- This phishing email was also sent to what appeared to be the sender's work email address. Other recipients included individuals at the same U.S. Government Agency, educational institutions, private sector organizations, and individual webmail addresses.
This attachment contained the file suprize.EXE (MD5: 09914ECC00284F01449015DFAFAED048).

Compiled: Wed, May 14 2014, 7:23:09 - 32 Bit EXE Version: FileVersion
This file installs two additional file: a Gh0st RAT implant and a keylogger data file.
C:\Windows\system32\6to4air.dll (MD5: EEB07F4EF4391D8E1063656A23C07913)
C:\Windows\system32\akylog.dat The file hash changes as key stroke data is written to it.
This is the Gh0st RAT implant. The file name was dynamically chosen based on service names found in this registry key: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\WindowsNT\CurrentVersion\SvcHost\netsvcs
